From: Joseph Reisinger <joeraii@...>
Subject: Python NEAT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=151231063
X-Yahoo-Profile: joeraii

I was inspired during the GECCO conference to get to work on my next set
of experiments, and luckily I had some time over the holiday weekend, so I
cranked out a general version of NEAT written in Python. "General" means
that it just has the elements of complexifying evolution and speciation,
and is pretty much domain-agnostic.

I've designed the system to be as extensible and user-friendly as possible
(based on my experience with the last implementation of NEAT I wrote :),
since I'd like to use it for several different experiments with and
without neural networks.

Anyway if anyone is interested, just drop me a line. So far the basic
system is complete, but I'm missing a lot of the nicer data vis and
recording features. Hopefully the system is extensible enough that I can
easily leverage some of the XML vis work going on here.

Joe

-- 

Joseph Reisinger
http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/joeraii
